alert.note: Alert for Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:52AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Walthall and east central Pike Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 752 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oak Vale to Holly Springs to 8 miles northwest of Tylertown. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tylertown and Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southern Mississippi.
